summary: An email from an Assistant U.S. Attorney to defense attorney Jay Lefkowitz, stating that the Deputy Attorney General has determined federal prosecution of Jeffrey Epstein is appropriate. It sets a deadline of June 30, 2008, for Epstein to comply with a plea agreement, including pleading guilty, being sentenced, and surrendering to begin his prison sentence.

persons.context: The recipient of the email, addressed as 'Mr. Leficowitz' (likely a typo for Lefkowitz). He is being informed of the decision regarding his client, Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Modification of Epstein Agreement

events.title: Deadline for Epstein's Plea and Surrender
events.description: The deadline for Jeffrey Epstein to comply with the plea agreement, including entering a guilty plea, being sentenced, and surrendering to begin his prison sentence.

keyFacts: The Deputy Attorney General completed a review and determined federal prosecution of Jeffrey Epstein was appropriate.
Epstein was given a firm deadline of June 30, 2008, to plead guilty, be sentenced, and surrender to begin his prison sentence.
The plea agreement had been previously modified by a U.S. Attorney's letter to a Ms. Sanchez on December 19th.
The communication is a formal notification from a federal prosecutor to Epstein's defense attorney, Jay Lefkowitz.
